short_summary: replacement of the existing multi-span timber bridge with a new vehicular bridge
description: the existing 18m multi-span timber bridge will be replaced by a 21m multi-span steel bridge with wood cladding, decking, and railings. the steel upper structure consists of stringers and diaphragms all of which is situated on elastomeric bearings. in order to limit ground disturbance at the site, the bridge will utilize 1.5m deep reinforced concrete pile caps with 14 micro-piles.",
full_summary:
G5P468-23-0070/A - Invitation to Qualify (ITQ)
Bridge Replacement - West Branch Ditch, Fort Henry National Historic Site of Canada

**Notice**
Bid submission procedures are as follows:

* Bids should be submitted via fax or email to the address: soumissionsami-bidsrpc@pc.gc.ca.
* Parks Canada is not accepting bids via SAP Ariba; bidders must submit their bid via fax or email as per the solicitation document.
* In-person or courier bids will not be accepted.

**Procurement Details**
This Invitation to Qualify (ITQ) is a two-stage process. The first stage evaluates the qualifications of interested suppliers, while the second stage invites qualified suppliers to submit a financial bid based on the project specifications and drawings.

**Project Information**
The existing 18m multi-span timber bridge at the Fort Henry National Historic Site requires replacement due to its end of life. The new bridge will be a 21m multi-span steel structure with wood cladding, decking, and railings. The project also involves rehabilitation of the existing heritage masonry and reconstruction of the pavement surface.

**Bid Submission Requirements**
Bidders are required to submit their qualifications in the first stage. The qualifications will be evaluated, and successful bidders will be invited to submit a financial bid in the second stage.

**Important Dates**
* Bid closing date: 2023-07-04T14:00:00
* Expected contract start date: 2023-08-01
* Expected contract end date: 2024-09-24

**Contact Information**
Annik Piché | annik.piche@pc.gc.ca | (581) 398-3489

**Additional Information**
National Parks Regulations require that all work is performed in accordance with the ordinances, laws, rules, and regulations set out in the National Park Act.
